news_header: Leos Hoplop, an adventure park company, is closing several playgrounds and ending employment for 70 people due to financial challenges.
news_text: Leos Hoplop, which operates five playgrounds, has announced the closure of its parks and the termination of employment for 70 staff members. Initially, the company planned to close about 10 of its 22 playgrounds, but fewer will be closed than anticipated. Change negotiations began on October 7, with potential impacts on up to 211 jobs. The company aims to improve profitability and operational capacity in response to high inflation and increased rental costs. Leos Hoplop is part of the international indoor playground chain Leos Lekland, which has locations in Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Germany.
